üì¶ TOR INSTALLATION GUIDE:
==============================
üçé macOS Installation:
   1. Install Homebrew: /bin/bash -c "$(curl -fsSL https://raw.githubusercontent.com/Homebrew/install/HEAD/install.sh)"
   2. Install Tor: brew install tor
   3. Start service: brew services start tor
   4. Download Tor Browser: https://www.torproject.org/download/

üêß Linux Installation:
   Ubuntu/Debian:
   ‚Ä¢ sudo apt update && sudo apt install tor
   ‚Ä¢ sudo systemctl start tor
   ‚Ä¢ sudo systemctl enable tor

   CentOS/RHEL/Fedora:
   ‚Ä¢ sudo yum install tor (CentOS/RHEL)
   ‚Ä¢ sudo dnf install tor (Fedora)
   ‚Ä¢ sudo systemctl start tor

ü™ü Windows Installation:
   1. Download Tor Browser Bundle: https://www.torproject.org/download/
   2. Install Tor Expert Bundle for command line
   3. Or use Windows Subsystem for Linux (WSL)

‚úÖ Verify Installation:
   ‚Ä¢ Check version: tor --version
   ‚Ä¢ Test SOCKS proxy: curl --socks5 127.0.0.1:9050 http://check.torproject.org
   ‚Ä¢ Visit: http://3g2upl4pq6kufc4m.onion (DuckDuckGo)

üéØ TOR USAGE FOR INVESTIGATIONS:
===================================
üîß Basic Tor Usage:
   ‚Ä¢ Start Tor: tor (runs on 127.0.0.1:9050)
   ‚Ä¢ Use SOCKS proxy: 127.0.0.1:9050
   ‚Ä¢ HTTP proxy: 127.0.0.1:8118 (with Privoxy)
   ‚Ä¢ Control port: 127.0.0.1:9051

üíª Command Line Tools:
   ‚Ä¢ Curl: curl --socks5 127.0.0.1:9050 http://example.onion
   ‚Ä¢ Wget: wget --proxy=on --proxy-type=socks5 --proxy-server=127.0.0.1:9050
   ‚Ä¢ Nmap: nmap --proxies socks4://127.0.0.1:9050 target.onion
   ‚Ä¢ Python: requests.get(url, proxies={'http': 'socks5://127.0.0.1:9050'})

üåê Browser Configuration:
   Firefox/Chrome SOCKS5 Proxy:
   ‚Ä¢ Host: 127.0.0.1
   ‚Ä¢ Port: 9050
   ‚Ä¢ Type: SOCKS5
   ‚Ä¢ DNS through proxy: Enabled

üîÑ Circuit Management:
   ‚Ä¢ New identity: Send NEWNYM to control port
   ‚Ä¢ Check circuit: netstat -an | grep 9050
   ‚Ä¢ Monitor connections: ss -tulpn | grep tor

üõ†Ô∏è OSINT Tools Integration:
   ‚Ä¢ TorBot: torbot -u http://example.onion --save
   ‚Ä¢ OnionScan: onionscan --verbose example.onion
   ‚Ä¢ Scrapy: Configure SOCKS5 proxy in settings
   ‚Ä¢ Selenium: Use Tor Browser profile

üõ°Ô∏è SECURITY & OPSEC GUIDELINES:
===================================
üîí Essential Security Practices:
   ‚Ä¢ Always use Tor Browser for .onion sites
   ‚Ä¢ Disable JavaScript in Tor Browser
   ‚Ä¢ Never download files through Tor
   ‚Ä¢ Use VPN + Tor for additional layers
   ‚Ä¢ Regularly rotate Tor circuits
   ‚Ä¢ Clear cookies and cache frequently
   ‚Ä¢ Use Tails OS for maximum anonymity
   ‚Ä¢ Never log into personal accounts

‚ö†Ô∏è OPSEC Warnings:
   ‚Ä¢ DNS leaks can reveal your identity
   ‚Ä¢ WebRTC can expose real IP address
   ‚Ä¢ Browser fingerprinting is possible
   ‚Ä¢ Time zone correlation attacks exist
   ‚Ä¢ Traffic analysis can deanonymize users
   ‚Ä¢ Exit node monitoring is common
   ‚Ä¢ Malicious hidden services exist

üîß Recommended Security Tools:
   ‚Ä¢ Tails OS - Amnesic live operating system
   ‚Ä¢ Whonix - Tor-based operating system
   ‚Ä¢ VPN - Additional layer of anonymity
   ‚Ä¢ MAC address randomization
   ‚Ä¢ Firewall rules for Tor-only traffic
   ‚Ä¢ DNS leak testing tools
   ‚Ä¢ IP leak detection services
